oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Poets and Prophets program - Bill Anderson - 2009-12-12
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Poets and Prophets interview program and performance with singer/songwriter Bill Anderson from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on December 12, 2009.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bill Anderson;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Hosted by Michael Gray. Includes performances. Includes selected audio excerpts and audio from video. Subjects include; What Bill is trying to say with his song writing -- the song Po' Folks -- Family history -- Inspirations -- Writing autobiographical songs -- Music heard while growing up -- Local musical influence -- Don Reno story -- Third grade teacher report card story regarding whispering -- Moving to Georgia and beginning to write -- Getting his first guitar -- Forming his first band -- Attending college -- Working as a radio disc jockey -- Getting serious about songwriting and the creation of the song City Lights -- Jim Denny story -- Lessons he learned from Buddy Killen -- Moving to Nashville in January 1960 and what the music culture was like at the time -- Co-writing When Two Worlds Collide with Roger Miller -- Writing the song Tips Of My Fingers -- The art of songwriting -- The song Saginaw, Michigan and Lefty Frizzell's recording of it -- Lefty Frizzell story --

Musical partnership with Connie Smith and her signing with RCA -- Why he stopped writing during the late 1970's and the 1980's -- How he reappeared on the songwriting scene -- Meeting up with and co-writing with Vince Gill -- Co-writing with Dean Dillon -- Writing the song Whiskey Lullaby with Jon Randall -- Writing the song Give It Away -- Performances include: Wherever She Is -- The Songwriters -- Too Country (with story about the inspiration for the song) --
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Anderson, Bill; Country Music Hall of Fame & Museum (Nashville, Tenn.);
